column4: dunno about google chrome, but usually system wide-config files goes in /etc, user config files goes hidden in your home folder (. prefix), /usr/bin goes binaries, /usr/share goes shared files,/usr/lib goes libraries, and finally /opt goes a few packages, could be there.
try the mozilla folder, or create one. webkit gets flash from mozilla plugins folder
Thanks I am trying
if you installed it under /opt, it usually wont install anything over /usr
Yup, I think thats right
i'm installing it to check it out
install the plugins from the repository, they work
tried it now, it runs every plugin that firefox supports
yup, I have done and all the browsers running it except chrome
that's weird, have you installed it throught the .deb package from google?
yup, that was easy
try this page: it shows all plugins currently running. tried it, shows the same as webkit epiphany and firefox: http://www-trunk.stage.mozilla.com/en-US/plugincheck/
well, ok

if you're running GNOME, its gksudo nautilus /
you'll get nautilus as root
